verses.verse: “All this I have observed with my own eyes; my ears have heard and understood it.
What you know, I also know; I am not inferior to you in any way.
But I only wish to speak with the Almighty and to argue my case with God.
As for you, you are obscuring the truth with lies, and the solutions you offer are all worthless.
“Oh, if only you would be completely silent! For you, that would be regarded as wisdom.
Hear now my reasoning and listen to the plea that issues from my lips.
Is it on God’s behalf that you utter lies? Is it in his defense that you speak deceitfully?
Will you show partiality for him as you plead his case?
“Will you feel totally comfortable when he examines you? Will you be able to deceive him as you deceive men?
If you show partiality, even though not flagrant, he will surely rebuke you.
Will not his majesty frighten you and the fear of him overcome you?
The ideas you propose are proverbs of ash; your arguments are defenses of clay.
“Be silent so that I may speak on my own behalf. Then let what may come upon me.
I am taking my life in my own hands and placing myself in jeopardy.
Perhaps he may slay me, but I have no other hope than to defend my conduct before him.
This will prove to be my salvation, for the godless will not dare to come before him.
“Therefore, listen carefully to my words and give my defense a careful hearing.
I have prepared my case carefully, and I am certain that I will be vindicated.
If anyone can make a valid case against me, then I will be silent and die.
“Only grant me two things, O God, and then I will not hide myself from your face:
just withdraw your hand far from me, and stop frightening me with your terrors.
Then summon me, and I will answer, or let me speak first, and then you can reply.
“Of how many crimes and sins am I guilty? Make known to me my faults and my transgressions.
Why do you hide your face[c] and look upon me as your enemy?
Will you harass a wind-blown leaf and chase after dry chaff?
“For you have drawn up bitter charges against me and caused me to suffer for the iniquities of my youth,
putting my feet in the stocks and keeping a close watch on every step I take as you trace all my footprints.
Thus, I waste away like rotting wood or like a moth-eaten garment.
